comment: I am not a fan of group projects but I did like this teacher. She is very nice and genuinely cares about her students

The class is really hard & my midterm grade was a D, but I finished with a B. There's a discussion post and quiz each week, and we had 4 exams (lock down browser) but lowest got dropped. If you do the work and study the lecture slides, you'll do ok though. The tests are hard but DP and extra credit help w/ your grade. Dr. Justus is really nice too!

Dr. Justus was an amazing professor! Her lectures and assignments was interesting. We had 5-6 labs throughout the course, alongside 3 speaker reflections. We had 3 test which we could use 2 notecards on, and the Final had a take home portion with it. She is very understanding towards situations with her students, and overall a great person.

Dr.Justus does really care about her students and offers plenty of help if we need it. She gives us enjoyable activities and takes attendance by daily participation. I really enjoyed her class and even looked into if there was any I could take in the future as well. You can tell she cares about what she does and her students!

I am taking her right now and she is so good! I went through some personal issues and let her know ahead of time that I wouldn't be able to make some classes, and she was VERY easy to work with. She is very personable and funny, I love her . Seems like a lot of grades in the gradebook but so easy to get an A if you just do them.

Dr. Justus is an amazing professor. The class itself was very informational. Be prepared to work for the grade. There's a lot of coursework, but they aren't extensive or boring. Exams are in person but she always helps you prepare! She's very knowledgeable. She also likes feedback, which helps shape the class experience. I highly recommend her!
I was nervous about taking this class at first but professor Justus made this course super easy.
